thread.title: Was Leonardo DiCaprio to blame for Oscars Best Picture blunder?
thread.title_full: Was Leonardo DiCaprio to blame for Oscars Best Picture blunder?

author: Adam Boult
title: Was Leonardo DiCaprio to blame for Oscars Best Picture blunder?
text:
Was Leonardo DiCaprio to blame for Oscars Best Picture blunder? Emma Stone accepts Best Actress Oscar for La La Land from Leonardo DiCaprio Credit: Kevin Winter/Getty Images Adam Boult 27 February 2017 ‚Ä¢ 10:38am 
D id Leonardo DiCaprio engineer a huge blunder at the 2017 Oscars to get revenge on the Academy for the years he was denied an award? 
Short answer: no - but it's nevertheless a fun conspiracy theory. 
In the minutes and hours following the extraordinary Oscars 2017 Best Picture mix-up - in which Warren Beatty and Faye Dunaway announced that La La Land had won the award, rather than actual winner Moonlight - social media flew into a frenzy of speculation over why the error had taken place. 
A number of amateur sleuths quickly identified one unlikely culprit - Leonardo DiCaprio. 
The Leo-did-it conspiracy theorists noted Warren Beatty's explanation for why he'd named the wrong film - he'd been handed the wrong card. 
But where did the card come from? Watch | Moonlight wins Best Picture after La La Land mistakenly named winner 02:06 
I mmediately prior to the Best Picture announcement, Emma Stone had accepted her award for Best Actress - and DiCaprio, presenting, had walked off stage with the red card under his arm. 
And so, the theory goes, Leo's card had somehow ended up in Warren Beatty's hands: Okay but you know who the last person who had that Emma Stone/La La Land card was? LEONARDO DICAPRIO #Oscars pic.twitter.com/QtzZHx5lGk ‚Äî Julia Woolever (@juliawool) February 27, 2017 OMG IT WAS LEO's FAULT. HE HAD THE ENVELOPE. pic.twitter.com/OJiSbSrFVj ‚Äî kelly oxford (@kellyoxford) February 27, 2017 LEO CARRIED THAT CARD OFFSTAGE PUT IT DOWN WHEN HE SAW WARREN AND WARREN PICKED IT UP üïµüèº‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è #oscars pic.twitter.com/uIOE54oy23 ‚Äî kelly oxford (@kellyoxford) 27 February 2017 HOW DID THE CARD GET FROM LEO‚ÄôS HAND TO WARREN‚ÄôS HAND? WE HAVE AN OSCAR CONSPIRACY TO UNCOVER. https://t.co/LUxYkjSYnq ‚Äî Sam Vecenie (@Sam_Vecenie) February 27, 2017 Someone follow the trail of the red card from Leo's hand during best actress Warren's hand and get to the bottom of #bestpicturegate #Oscars ‚Äî Janice Thomas (@JaniceThomas) February 27, 2017 We all know Leo switched the envelopes as revenge because he received his #Oscars so late in his career...
